1.label: Lifeline
1.description: Strips supports association group 1 (lifeline), max 1 node, normally used to send Stripsâ€™notification to the Z-Wave controller.

options.label: Binary sensor report + Notification report (Access Control)

2.label: LED indication
2.description: Turn On or Off LED for specific event indications (ex. alarms).

options.label: Turns off LED for door open events

15.label: Activate supervision
15.description: Activate Supervision command for only important alarm events or all events. Supervised commands require a confirmation from the gateway when a notification is received.

options.label: Events sent with S2 Encapsulation only
Only Door Open Alarm Report (Events sent with S2 and supervision encapsulation)
Unsolicited reports (Door Open/Close, Tamper clear, Wake-up notification and Battery Report events sent with S2 and supervision encapsulation)

16.label: Supervision report wait time
16.description: Only used if parameter 22 is set to 1 (High security). The number of milliseconds to wait for a Supervision response when a Supervised message is sent.

17.label: Number of failed event retries
17.description: Only used if parameter 22 is set to 1 (High security). Number of retries when a confirmation is not received. 0 = No retry, 1 - 5 = Number of retries when a confirmation is not received.

18.label: Failed Event Retry Interval
18.description: Only used if parameter 22 is set to 1 (High security). The minimum number of seconds between retries. Min = 1 second, Max = 60 seconds

19.label: Heartbeat interval
19.description: Only used if parameter 22 is set to 1 (High security). Number of minutes between periodic battery reports (Heartbeats). Accepts multiples of 5 mins. Any arbitary value between 5 and 70 will be rounded up to a multiple of 5.

22.label: Security Level
22.description: Select the level of security. High Security (Enables parameters 16-19, 21). Standard (Forces parameter behaviour as follows: #16=1000, #17=Sensative standard**, #18=0, #19=Off, #21=Off ** Retries with an incrementally longer period until reconnected.
